reviews.text: We had a great time in St. Lucia and the Coconut Bay Resort and Spa. This hotel is clean, spacious, and very tropical. Our room was on the 4th floor, which afforded us a great ocean view. The pools and jacuzzi were terrific, and the ocean, even with the seaweed, is usable. We spent many days under the palapala on the beach, just relaxing. We took a nice walk down the beach where windsurfing and kiter surfing were offered at the Reef. This paritucar stretch of beach was beautiful and without seaweed. The Reef bar was a cozy spot to have a beer and relish in the beauty and tranquility of this beautiful island. We also hired a taxi and took a couple of day trips to the Volcano and Botantical Garden. We also went to Castries and ate lunch at Marigot Bay. What a breath-taking view! Dr. Do Little was flimed here. Coconut Bay is within 5 minutes of the airport, but you would never know it. The few flights in and out a day were hardly noticed.
reviews.title: Great time at Coconut Bay Resort and Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Coconut Bay is affordable yet offers the traveler a great place to stay on vacation. While not a five star hotel, it is definitely a 3 1/2 property. We would highly recommend it!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

likes.liked: — Staff, food, condition of the resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where shall I start, what a superb resort.
reviews.title: Great deal for some winter sun relaxation!

reviews.text: Location - We were so pleased to discover on arrival the hotel is literally 5 mins from the airport. Most other resorts are a 90 min drive away, which, after experiencing St Lucia's sharp, twisting, steep mountainous roads, is not what you need after a 8 hour flight. The airport has about 3 flights a day so noise is not an issue.
reviews.title: Nice place, wrong location

reviews.text: Hotel - Very clean, very tidy, well maintained. The gardens are worked on daily and look beautiful, the cleaners keep the resort sparkling. The rooms are scrubbed daily to.
reviews.title: Resort and Spaaaaaaaaaaaaah

likes.disliked: — Outside the resort there was not much to do unless you drove to the other side of the island.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I (married 10/14) arrived on 10/15 for our honeymoon, and where greated by a very nice lady at the front desk. Our first impression, once out of the van, was jaw dropping, with its HUGE open air lobby and bar area. After a long flight via American Airlines from Ohio we needed this relaxation to take place and it did once we stepped foot here!
reviews.title: Excellent place to relax!

likes.liked: — The staff was some of the nicest I have ever met while on vacation.
likes.disliked: — Some of the food wasnt to my tasting.

reviews.title: Too far away for us.
reviews.text: I cannot put into words how extremely nice each and every one of the resort staff was! The food was good and the restruants upstairs where elegant. The pools where nice and clean. The drinks especially from the bartenders Dona, Skeet, Big Ted, Lance, Jamal, and Charlston where excellent. Hats off to all that served us. I dont understand how people can give this place a poor rating but to each his own. Our room on the 4th floor, which was nice, the AC was cold, and view was simply amazing. We stayed here for 7 nights and we wish we had 3 more, haha! For families this place is a must kids looked like they where having a blast and for us on our honeymoon we didnt even realize it was a family resort. The beaches have a lil seaweed but thats excepted on the Altantic side and we knew that coming into this resort but they are out there every morning at 5am cleaning the beaches for people.
BOTTOM LINE:
reviews.title: All in all, it was OK!!!

reviews.text: We will go back sometime soon, highly recomened! Good luck and have fun!
reviews.title: could do better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at CBR for a few days and it was okay but I will not return.
reviews.title: Awesome long weekend, would definitely go back again.

likes.liked: — The amazing staff, lazy river, the heavy-handed bartenders.
likes.disliked: — The location (sort of far from a lot of things), reservations with the restaurants and it being closed on Saturdays, need more activities for adults.

reviews.text: After reading all of the reviews about this place I wasn't expecting much. To quash all of the nasty rumors that some of these reviews gripe about:
reviews.title: Exceeded Expecatations!!

reviews.text: - The airport is indeed 5 minutes away. This is a blessing, most people have to travel 1 1/2 hours to get to their resorts and believe me the rides are fulls of hills and turns. There are max 4 flights a day so it is hardly a bother
reviews.title: Travel Agent comments

likes.liked: — clean, staff english speaking, good kids program, beach front, safe drinking water

reviews.text: - The beach. Yes the beach is on the Atlantic Ocean side of the island and snorkeling really isn't an option, however, it is far from disgusting. The staff scoops all of the grass off of the beach daily and the sand is nice to walk or lay on. Not a problem at all.
reviews.title: Great Spa!Yeah Right!
Loved It
reviews.text: There were 12 of us in our party and my girlfriend and I got engaged and married all in the same week. The Wedding staff (Sylvie and Tracie) were excellent and you couldn't have asked for a nicer wedding especially in such a short amount of time (it wasn't palnned until the 2nd day we were there). My girlfriend didn't have a dress so they had their florist check out the shops in town, provided us where there were dresses and booked a taxi for my girlfriend to go into town and try them on.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff really seemed to go out of their way to make you happy. Skeet at the lobby bar is as advertised, make sure you see him. The kids had plenty to do.
reviews.title: Relaxing and Fun Four-Day Weekend

likes.disliked: — Having to change rooms on the last day

reviews.text: I luv this place
reviews.title: lovin it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very nice staff
reviews.title: We had a great time

reviews.text: nice winds, great pools,lots do for kids
reviews.title: Wonderful Trip

reviews.text: great staff
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel and friendly staff, highly recommended

reviews.text: Room 203 ok, beds comfy but to small for me ;) i think for the caribbean in general good u see the rooms are used,and that there is a lack of detail work, but in general good
reviews.title: Great Family Vacation for all Ages

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I spent a week at Coconut Bay Resort in January 2011. There were definite pluses and some minuses as well. The good: the sulphur springs/volcano/mud bath excursion was an amazing once-in -a-lifetime activity that is a must-do! the drinks are free AND really strong which doesn't always happen at an all-inclusive resort. Nice clean rooms, lots of food choices, beach grill was excellent, waterslide and lazy river were superfun, upstairs lounge area with beds and disco were nice to have around. Make SURE you get a cab to the LIGHTHOUSE on the mountain near the resort- it's not advertised, but we heard thru word of mouth, and it was the most AMAZING views we have ever seen in our lives- we got amazing pictures. The bad: it rained a lot in January which became very frustrating, when it wasn't raining, it was cloudy and not the warmest (esp with the atlantic ocean breezes), the beach was very subpar since it was on the Atlantic side- seaweed galore and certainly no crystal-clear waters, driving around the island is a nightmare even if you don't normally get motion sick- every road is super windy and right on a cliff. No real entertainment. Also, there weren't enough people at CBR to go on certain excursions so, although advertised, we were unable to go. We had to book our own cab (which was actually cheaper) so don't book thru the reps at the hotel- it's cheaper to pay a cab driver to take you where you want. While the Italian restaurant was good, the Asian one made me vomit all night- be careful!! Bottom line: if you are looking for a perfect beach, don't go here. If you are looking for amazing picturesque views and excursions, check out St. Lucia.
reviews.title: Some good, some bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: enjoy every second..the people are the most open friendly peple i'v had the pleasure of meeting im still smilling after 10 hours on a airplane ..thankyou st lucia
reviews.title: breathtaking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelled to a few resorts now, this was the best. Food was great!...every evening they had great entertainment, lots of pools and the beach was always keeped clean...KUDOS to the staff, Small J, Ekon and Maclee...
reviews.title: Food and service was wonderful!....and 5 minutes from airport!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this place - I cannot understand why people would not be happy here. Having travelled to much more expensive resorts in Tobago and the Maldives recently we were worried and set our hopes pretty low but I have to say this place is fantastic.
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations

reviews.text: Rooms - suggest upgrading to a 4th floor premium ocean room. We did and loved it.
reviews.title: Genuine, sincere and friendly service with thoughtful management

reviews.text: We had a group of 30 family and friends that travel once a year for the Presidents Week vacation; this year we went to Coconut Bay and I must say we were very happy with the place. My husband and I, 5 year old, 3 year old and 18 month old all had a great time. The rooms were clean, the food was good (not the greatest) but certainly not like some of these reviews. The kids loved the water slides, the kids club, the endless popcorn and cotton candy. Everybody was so nice here and for the rare negative reviews on trip advisor I would say those people maybe want 5 star resort for cheaper price. This place was GREAT for the kids, they loved it. I would say the only negative for the place is that there is no waitress service by the pool and that gets annoying, especially when the lines tend to get long at the bar / grill area for food. That really was the only annoying thing here. I was worried about the bug spraying and that was really nothing at all. Beach is nice, nothing like any of the negative reviews. We went on a busy week, being schools were closed in the US and we had no issues whatsoever finding chairs by the pool everyday, even for a group of 30. All in all a great family vacation, very nice people and I don't normally write reviews but I just wanted people to know that contrary to any negative reviews this place was really nice. I would def take the family back again.
reviews.title: Great place for family vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean rooms, food is good, great location if you are a kiteboarder or windsurfer. 2Elements (kiteboarding & windsurfing rental/lessons) is a short walk down the beach. It's an all inclusive. Kind of expensive. The Italian restaurant is ok, the Chinese restaurant is not too good, the buffet is pretty good. The internet in the room is awful to nonexistent. There is a waitress there named Mona Lisa who is very pleasant and friendly and provides great service.
reviews.title: Nice place to visit especially if you are a kiteboarder or windsurfer.

reviews.text: We spent five nights at the Coconut Bay Resort & Spa and wish we could have stayed longer! The resort was gorgeous and clean, the food was great, and there were plenty of activities to keep occupy our three sons, ages 12, 11, and 7 years. They particularly enjoyed the waterslides, playing soccer, and hanging out with the other children they met there. My husband and I enjoyed long walks on the beach, sitting at the swim-up bar, and exploring the beautiful country of St. Lucia. We all enjoyed our visit to the volcano and rainforest. Can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: Can ALL of these recent reviews be correct?
reviews.title: Had a great time at Coconut Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great time had, can't wait to go back, awesome holiday... YES THEY CAN!!!
reviews.title: Excellent Holiday

reviews.text: A very good 3 star resort that is very close to the airport (5 minutes door to door). Great for kids. Pools, lazy river, water slide, even the beach (it is not as horrible as you would believe on shore - I wouldn't swim in the water though). Staff are genuinely fond of the kids and tend to remember their names. Kids Club is the best I have seen at any resort. The staff there are top notch and complement the excelllent facilites to leave a parent with a positive feeling about handing over your kids for a few hours! In fact the entire staff are equally good: even the Chief Engineer took time to ask our kids if they were having fun!
reviews.title: A good 3 star but beware of guest services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food is mediocre at best as selection is poor. I did not see any food recycling from meal to meal as some others point out. There are staples that are a part of every meal and I am sure that is what was referred to. We were always able to put together a meal in the buffet and it was good. A la carte restaurants are good, but not spectacular - certainly worth visiting. If the hotel is not busy you can eat at them all you want as they don't really enforce rules about maxium dinings. Bar service is quick and friendly. The bartender in the main bar can perform "cocktail" type antics if you get him going.
reviews.title: Loved it --

likes.liked: — The view from my room was absolutely breathtaking -
likes.disliked: — Condensation in the room after leaving the balcony door open - almost fell on the floor - as sign should be posted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beware of the guest services desk. We had booked a tour guide (taxi) for a 1/2 day excursion. We realized part way through that this was not the best driver as a guide and he skipped many sites, brought us back early, and did not afford us mutch time out of the car. We complained to the guest service desk immediately upon return to the hotel. They stalled us until 15 minutes before leaving. Paul (a front office manager) had the nerve to tell me that we should have confronted the driver or end the service where we were. He actually compared it to complaining about poor cable reception. I don't think it would be wise with 2 small children in tow to be stranded in Soufriere having to look for another cab. Bare in mind that this is a 3rd world Caribbean country and not all locals are friendly in this town (if they are they probably want $$ for rum). Besides, we booked through the hotel who should earn their commission on the deal. They promote the fact that they will protect you in such circumstances. If you want to do some sightseeing I suggest asking a staff member (one of them will befriend you in some way) for their knowledge of a driver or ask another hotel guest. If your cab from the airport does not immediately offer, ask for his/her card if he/she seems like fun. A 1/2 day should run you $75 or $100 with alchohol or other beverages supplied. Full day will be $100 +/-. You will pay a hefty premium with guest services and evidently be treated like a schmuck if you need them.
reviews.title: Relaxing & Great Time at Cocunut Bay Resort

likes.liked: — How relaxing it was... good food, drinks, & atmosphere.
likes.disliked: — The drive into town but at least you get to see more of the island this way.

reviews.text: If it weren't for the poor dealings and obvious stall tactics with Paul we would have left with positive feelings about the trip. I cannot believe that a hotel that strives to achieve so hard would have such policies as were exhibited toward us. Caveat Emptor...
reviews.title: fantastic wedding and hoilday

likes.liked: — the staff were so friendly and heplful
likes.disliked: — its location, to far form attractions

reviews.text: We booked through air Jamaica and it was well worth it - We descended there on November 16th and was thrilled at the big welcome in such a nice open - the Lobby. We were treated with a glass of Champayne while we waited for our luggage to be taken to our rooms. I must say that the staff was incredible especially Liza, one of the hostess (keep up that smile) at the buffet restaurant and Louisiana - towel centre. The two restaurants upstairs, the food was great and the service was exceptional while we were there - pls make reservations. Loved some of the activities except for the tribal ones on during the Saturday caribbean night -- One of the good things there are areas for kids and adults so the pool was not oversaturated with spoilt kids running around - Sadly no one was on the beach because of the seagrass - way too much but the pools and the sidebar and other amenities made up for it. - The rooms were cleaned and building nicely maintained - We are definitely coming back next year with our son -
reviews.title: Holiday, wedding and honeymoon - in Paradise!

likes.liked: — Huge air-conditioned spotlessly clean rooms, cheerful staff, SPA
likes.disliked: — Some of the rude fellow guests!

reviews.text: We found that every worker was so genuinely wonderfully nice to us. The food was great, the drinks were strong!! The entertainment great. We took a day excursion and it was well worth the money. What a great place to stay. Even the shampoo, etc in the bathroom were wonderful. Friendly, friendly staff. Wish we could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: paradise

reviews.text: We just returned from a week at Coconut Bay ,and it certainly exceeded our expectations. We are a family with 4 and 2 year old. Well travelled in the carribean, 1st time in St. Lucia on a word of mouth recommendation and proximity to windsurf/kitesurf location.
reviews.title: Perfect Family Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is clean, well maintained and well managed. Pool, entertainment, food/drink and views were excellent. Our favourite feature was the kids club, which is a fantastic facility that our 2 kids adored. No guilty feelings dropping them off in the morning, as they couldn't wait to go each day. Arts and crafts, cookie baking, outdoor play structure and water park. The staff is fantastic (Sarah, Alice, Nasha and Samanfer) and have different activities every day. While it is clearly geared to families, it doesn't feel overun with kids, and there's plenty of space to stretch out and find a quiet spot by the pool or beach on the "Splash" side.
reviews.title: relaxing stay

reviews.text: While the beach is a beautiful setting, it does get a lot of seaweed washed up. They powerake it every morning, but it's a losing battle against the Atlantic. The main buffet restaurant can feel quite noisy, but the staff are great, and they set up an outdoor lunch grill every day that was outstanding.
reviews.title: Amazing Family vacation at Coconut Bay

reviews.text: Overall we really enjoyed it and will certainly come back, probably next year!
reviews.title: Five Star Good Time
